spanishExample: Me lo pidieron hoy.
englishTranslation: They asked me for it today.
vocabIncluded: me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
pidieron: requested, they requested (Pedir, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Se los pedí a mi papá hoy.
englishTranslation: I asked my dad for them today.
vocabIncluded: "se" to mean "le" or "les", as in "se lo" or "se la"
a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
pedí: requested, I requested (Pedir, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Ellos te piden cincuenta pesos, pero yo te los pedí antes.
englishTranslation: They ask you for fifty pesos, but I asked you for them before.
vocabIncluded: pedí: requested, I requested (Pedir, preterite, 1st person)
peso: weight/peso as in currency (masc. noun)
piden: request, they request (Pedir, present, 3rd person plural)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Es cierto, nos preguntamos dónde están nuestros asientos.
englishTranslation: It’s true, we’re wondering where our seats are.
vocabIncluded: dónde: adverb meaning "where?" in a question or implied question
preguntamos: ask, we ask (Preguntar, present, 1st person plural)
preguntarse: any use of to ask with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to wonder)

spanishExample: Te pido que pongas el vuelto en esa caja.
englishTranslation: I’m asking you to put the change in that box.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pido: request, I request (Pedir, present, 1st person)
pongas: put, you put(Poner, subjunctive, 2nd person plural)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Siempre te pedimos lo mismo que ella te pide.
englishTranslation: We always ask you for the same thing she asks you for.
vocabIncluded: "lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"
pedimos: request, we request (Pedir, present, 1st person plural)
pide: requests, he/she/it requests (Pedir, present, 3rd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Pregunte lo que quiere saber, no importa si es personal.
englishTranslation: (formal) Ask what you want to know; it doesn’t matter if it’s personal.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
importa: matters, he/she/it matters (Importar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Me pregunto si me puedes dar el vuelto.
englishTranslation: I’m wondering if you can give me the change.
vocabIncluded: me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
preguntarse: any use of to ask with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to wonder)
pregunto: ask, I ask (Preguntar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Nos pidieron algo que ya nos habían pedido.
englishTranslation: They asked us for something they had already asked us for.
vocabIncluded: habían: "had", "they had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person plural)
nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")
pidieron: requested, they requested (Pedir, preterite, 3rd person plural)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Quiero que le preguntes si ya encontró los asientos.
englishTranslation: I want you to ask her if she already found the seats.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
encontró: found, he/she/it found (Encontrar, preterite, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
preguntes: ask, you ask (Preguntar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Al día siguiente la perra todavía estaba en la silla.
englishTranslation: The following day the dog(f) was still on the chair.
vocabIncluded: al: "to the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: No puedo sentarme ahí porque llevo un traje.
englishTranslation: I can't sit there because I’m wearing a suit.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
llevo: take, I take (Llevar, present, 1st person)
sentarse: any use of to sit with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to sit down)

spanishExample: Estoy segura de que la próxima semana van a preguntarme si tengo oro.
englishTranslation: I’m sure(f) that next week they’re going to ask me if I have gold.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
preguntarme: to ask me (Preguntar infinitive) + CONTRACTION
seguro: adjective meaning "sure" when used with Estar
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Quiere que le pidas cualquier cosa que necesites.
englishTranslation: He wants you to ask him for anything you need.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
pidas: request, you request(Pedir, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Si le pides que te diga la razón verdadera, te la dirá.
englishTranslation: If you ask her to tell you the real reason, she’ll tell you it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
dirá: "will say", "he/she/it will say" (Decir, future, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
pides: request, you request (Pedir, present, 2nd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Están pidiendo un café y quiero que me pidan uno también.
englishTranslation: They’re ordering a coffee, and I want them to order me one too.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
pidan: request, they request (Pedir, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Quiere pedirme que le dé efectivo, como diez pesos.
englishTranslation: He wants to ask me to give him cash, like ten pesos.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
pedirme: to request me (Pedir infinitive) + CONTRACTION
peso: weight/peso as in currency (masc. noun)

spanishExample: Ya le ha preguntado a todo el mundo.
englishTranslation: He has already asked everyone.
vocabIncluded: a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Quiero preguntarte si él te pidió un favor.
englishTranslation: I want to ask you if he asked you for a favor.
vocabIncluded: pidió: requested, he/she/it requested (Pedir, preterite, 3rd person)
preguntarte: to ask you (Preguntar infinitive) + CONTRACTION
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Ya me pediste eso y ahora él va a pedirle eso a su amigo.
englishTranslation: You already asked me for that and now he’s going to ask his friend for that.
vocabIncluded: a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
pedirle: to request him/her (Pedir infinitive) + CONTRACTION
pediste: requested, you requested (Pedir, preterite, 2nd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Le pregunta eso porque tú nunca se lo preguntaste.
englishTranslation: She’s asking her that because you never asked her it.
vocabIncluded: "se" to mean "le" or "les", as in "se lo" or "se la"
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
pregunta: asks, he/she/it asks (Preguntar, present, 3rd person)
preguntaste: asked, you asked (Preguntar, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Nos preguntamos si le pusimos mucha sal a la comida.
englishTranslation: We’re wondering if we put(past) a lot of salt on the food.
vocabIncluded: a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
preguntamos: ask, we ask (Preguntar, present, 1st person plural)
pusimos: put, we put (Poner, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Vamos a hacerlo cuando me pida que le haga un traje.
englishTranslation: We’re going to do it when he asks me to make him a suit.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
pida: request, he/she/it request (Pedir, subjunctive, 3rd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: La mayor parte de su familia estaba en casa y pedimos más sillas.
englishTranslation: Most of her family was at home and we asked for more chairs.
vocabIncluded: la mayor parte: the greater part/most (idiom)
pedimos: requested, we requested (Pedir, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Siempre nos preguntan lo mismo que él te preguntaba.
englishTranslation: They always ask us the same thing he used to ask you.
vocabIncluded: nos: "us" as an indirect object ("to us", "for us")
preguntaba: asked, he/she/it asked (Preguntar, imperfect, 3rd person)
preguntan: ask, they ask (Preguntar, present, 3rd person plural)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Cada vez que vengo a tu casa te pregunto dónde está la basura.
englishTranslation: Every time I come to your house I ask you where the trash is.
vocabIncluded: dónde: adverb meaning "where?" in a question or implied question
pregunto: ask, I ask (Preguntar, present, 1st person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
vengo: come, I come (Venir, present, 1st person) NEEDS WORK

spanishExample: ¿Tienes algo de efectivo? Porque yo no tengo cambio.
englishTranslation: Do you have some cash? Because I don’t have any change.

spanishExample: Lo haré cuando me pida que deje la basura afuera.
englishTranslation: I’ll do it when he asks me to leave the trash outside.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
haré: "will do/make", "I will do/make" (Hacer, future, 1st person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
pida: request, he/she/it request (Pedir, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No sé por qué me preguntas si era diferente, pregúntale a tu hermano.
englishTranslation: I don’t know why you’re asking me if it was different, ask your brother.
vocabIncluded: a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
preguntas: ask, you ask (Preguntar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Me preguntaron si la comida tenía mucha sal.
englishTranslation: They asked me if the food had a lot of salt.
vocabIncluded: me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
preguntaron: asked, they asked (Preguntar, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Encontraron oro en la parte trasera de ese lugar.
englishTranslation: They found gold in the rear part of that place.
vocabIncluded: encontraron: found, they found (Encontrar, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Quiere que pregunte si me puedo sentar en este banco.
englishTranslation: He wants me to ask if I can sit on this bench.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pregunte: ask, I ask (Preguntar, subjunctive, 1st person)
sentarse: any use of to sit with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to sit down)

spanishExample: No preguntaré eso, sé que está en una caja.
englishTranslation: I won’t ask that, I know that it’s in a box.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
preguntaré: will ask, I will ask (Preguntar, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Pregunta si pueden darte algo de cambio en el lugar oficial.
englishTranslation: Ask if they can give you some change in the official place.

spanishExample: Me están preguntando lo mismo que te pregunté el año pasado.
englishTranslation: They’re asking me the same thing I asked you last year.
vocabIncluded: "lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
pregunté: asked, I asked (Preguntar, preterite, 1st person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: No te quiero preguntar nada porque necesito tomar mi propia decisión.
englishTranslation: I don’t want to ask you anything because I need to make my own decision.
vocabIncluded: necesito: need, I need (Necesitar, present, 1st person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: No quieren que te pregunte eso porque ellos te van a pedir un favor.
englishTranslation: They don’t want me to ask you that because they are going to ask you a favor.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pregunte: ask, I ask (Preguntar, subjunctive, 1st person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: ¿Puedo pedirte que te sientes conmigo en este banco?
englishTranslation: Can I ask you to sit with me on this bench?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pedirte: to request you (Pedir infinitive) + CONTRACTION
sentarse: any use of to sit with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to sit down)
sientes: sit, you sit (Sentar, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡No le preguntes lo mismo que ella te preguntó!
englishTranslation: Don’t ask her the same thing she asked you!
vocabIncluded: "lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
preguntó: asked, he/she/it asked (Preguntar, preterite, 3rd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Es normal, me va a pedir que esté con la perra por una hora.
englishTranslation: It’s normal, she’s going to ask me to be with the dog(f) for an hour.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: No quiere preguntarle eso porque yo siempre le preguntaba lo mismo.
englishTranslation: He doesn’t want to ask her that because I always asked her the same thing.
vocabIncluded: le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
preguntaba: asked, I asked (Preguntar, imperfect, 1st person)
preguntarle: to ask him/her (Preguntar infinitive) + CONTRACTION
